identity.name: E1
principles: Fusion over Imitation: Mix Classical Chess aesthetics with Cyberpunk Data visualization.
Emotion First: Every screen should feel like a high-stakes tournament match.
Content is King: The board and the commentary are the heroes.
Zoom In: Use macro photography of pieces to create intimacy.
Negative Space: Allow the mind to think. Don't clutter.

heading.usage: Main headlines, hero sections, big numbers.

mono.usage: Chess moves (e.g., 1. e4 e5), PGN data, code snippets.

rules: Overlines must be uppercase and tracking-widest.

colors.theme_strategy: Dark Mode First (The Study), Light Mode Secondary (The Tournament Hall)

buttons.outline: border border-input bg-background hover:bg-accent hover:text-accent-foreground rounded-lg

layout.spacing_scale: Generous. Use p-8, p-12 for sections.

grid_systems.landing: Tetris Grid (Mode A): grid-cols-1 md:grid-cols-12 gap-8. Hero spans 8, secondary spans 4.
grid_systems.dashboard: Bento Grid (Mode B): grid-cols-1 md:grid-cols-4 gap-4. Dense, high information density.

images.description: Close up of chess pieces (Knight focus) for Hero section. Dark, moody.
Abstract blue/gold neural network for AI analysis section.
Man focused on laptop in cafe for 'Training' or 'Dashboard' context.
Clean chess board view for general usage.

assets.icons: Use 'lucide-react' for UI icons. Use 'fa-solid' (FontAwesome) via react-icons if specific chess pieces are needed as icons.

guidelines: Use spring physics for board piece movement.
Page transitions: Opacity fade + slight Y-axis slide.

instructions_to_main_agent: 1. INSTALL FONTS: Add Syne, Manrope, and JetBrains Mono to index.css via @import or HTML head.
2. SETUP THEME: Implement the 'dark' class toggle logic in a ThemeProvider.
3. LANDING PAGE: Build a 'Tetris' grid layout. Use the 'hero_main' image as a massive visual anchor (col-span-8). Overlay big 'Syne' typography.
4. DASHBOARD: Create a dense 'Bento' grid. Use the 'glass' card style. Visualize 'Mistakes' with the Red semantic color.
5. GAME ANALYSIS: This is the core. Split screen. Left: Interactive Board (use a library like 'chessboard.jsx' or similar if available, or mock it). Right: AI Chat/Commentary stream.
6. AI COMMENTARY: Style it like a chat application but with 'Grandmaster' persona. Use the 'ai_visualization' image as a subtle background or avatar.
7. MISTAKE TRACKER: Use progress bars colored by the semantic palette (Red for Blunders, Green for Best Moves).
8. TESTING: Add data-testid to all interactive elements (buttons, inputs, board squares).
universal_guidelines: Avoid 'AI Slop': No generic centered layouts.
Dark colors look good when used independently without gradients. DO NOT use dark colors as gradients.
Create depth through layered design elements with z-index hierarchy.
Use glass-morphism effects with backdrop filters (12-24px blur).
